cyclone.name: COLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles NW of Cozumel, Mexico and 550 miles SW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northeast and expected to accelerate toward the Florida Big Bend, then cross Florida and emerge off the northeast Florida/Georgia coast before continuing along the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (Indian Pass–Cedar Key area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect; interests along northeastern Florida through southern South Carolina advised to monitor
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning – Indian Pass to Englewood (Florida Gulf Coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast, Florida Peninsula (including east-central coast), then Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Low (3-8%) chance of experiencing tropical-storm-force gusts; sustained winds more likely below gale force
weather_observation.storm_surge: Atlantic side surge expected to be minor, generally less than 2 ft above normal tide levels
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain 3–5 in. with locally higher amounts could cause ponding and localized flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible Monday afternoon and evening as rain bands sweep across central Florida
